Cristina is a housewife who, as means of having an income of her own with which to help her husband cover the household expenses, sells clothing, shoes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She sells her goods from door to door for two to three hours a day, three days a week.  She leaves goods with her customers on credit and makes collections every eight days.  She has been running the business for 2 years and it is doing very well, her most-sold items being perfume and cosmetics.  She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.  This is her fourth loan from the credit group which she likes because it is easy to make her repayments.  Her dream is to own her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Cordial saludo.
Ella es lina Marcela quien está vinculada al instituto Campo Alto como estudiante de enfermería en la jornada de la noche.
Está interesada en obtener un descuento con kiva en el valor de la pensión; el motivo que la mueve para hacer esta solicitud obedece por una parte a que esta haciendo un gran esfuerzo trabajando durante el día para poderse costear la carrera en horas de la noche, además que es madre soltera de un niño de dos años y también debe ayudar a la señora madre que en la actualidad se encuentra sin trabajo, por lo cual debe encargarse de todos los gastos de la casa en donde vive de arriendo con ellos dos.
El segundo motivo es el deseo que tiene de terminar la carrera, para que en un futuro con una mayor capacitación  pueda devengar un mejor salario para tener una buena calidad de vida y de este modo poder costearse la carrera como enfermera jefe, ya que siempre le ha apasionado todo lo relacionado con la salud por considerar que es la mejor  forma para poder ayudar a las personas que carecen de este primordial derecho a la salud como parte esencial de la vida. 
Todas las cosas que ella se propone hacer es para salir adelante con el hijo y la señora madre todo lo hace por el bienestar de ellos y para que en el día de mañana se sientan orgullosos de ella  y consigo misma de poder ver realizado el sueño que tenia.
Gracias por la atención prestada
texts.en:
Warmest greetings. 

This is Lina Marcela, who is associated with the Campo Alto institute as a nursing student during the night school. She is interested in obtaining a discount with Kiva in the cost of tuition. The reason why she is making this request is partly because she is making a big effort working during the day to be able to pay for her night classes. In addition, she is a single mother of a two year old boy and she also has to help her mother who is unemployed right now. She has to take care of all of the household expenses where the two of them are renting. 

The second reason is that she wants to finish her degree so that in the future with more training, she will be able to earn a better salary to have a better quality of life and pay to study and become head nurse. She has always been passionate about everything related to health because she considers it the best way to be able to help people who lack this basic right to health as an essential part of life. 
 
Everything she proposes is to get ahead with her son and her mother. Everything she does is for their well being so that one day they will feel proud of her and she of herself, for having realized the dream that she has. Thank you for your attention.

loans.use: to pay to register for a semester.

loans.name: Maryan

texts.en:
Maryan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo.

Maryan is a 19-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small simple house in the city. Her father works as an employee in the public sector with a low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. Maryan is a student in a local university where she studies information systems. She is a very clever student and she gets good grades. 

Maryan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Maryan will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Josephine's group and is composed of four persons who are friends living in the same community. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ID-Ghana to boost their businesses. 

Josephine is 40 years old. She is married to Peter, a 45-year-old electrician.They have two children. Josephine has had education to the secondary school level and the leader of her group. She together with her husband ensure that the household expenses are covered. To meet the needs of her family, she has been selling sugar and maize for about eleven years in front of her house. Seeking to satisfy her customer and to increase her income, Josephine, together with the other members of the group, is requesting a fifth loan. The previous loans were indeed repaid without any default. The entire group needs GHS 4,200 to buy more goods to satisfy their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize for her customers.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is her mid-50's and is a widowed woman. Sharifa has five children, three sons and two daughters; only one of them lives at home and is school. The rest have finished schooling. 

For a period of 20 years now, Sharifa has made her living by running a genge selling fruits and vegetables. Sharifa gets up earlier in the morning (7 am) to start her business. Sometimes she needs to start in the market center to buy new fruits and vegetables. Her business is not located far from her home, so it ends at night (8 pm). She is able to make a very good profit per day. 

Sharifa is requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which is her tenth loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge. She will use this loan to pay for new business stock. 

She used her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock her business with fruits and vegetables. 

Sharifa used her business profit to build a house, bought home furniture, and covered school fees and home expenses.  She dreams of expanding her business up to a genge duka. 

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group,” Mkombozi”, which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for her new business stock.

loans.name: Carlos Sebastian

texts.es:
Carlos de 23 años de edad, casado sin hijos, es originario de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven ha luchado en la vida para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por las carencias económicas por la que su familia vivía... en la actualidad lucha para obtener mejores condiciones de vida.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es un pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Carlos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: 23-year-old Carlos is single and has no children. He comes from Jinotepe, a town in the northern part of the country. He is known as a hardworking and responsible person who has a great determination to succeed. Since he was a child he has worked hard to help with the household expenses.  Unfortunately, he was not able to have an education due to his family's lack of financial resources... he is currently striving to improve his living conditions.   His efforts and determination to get by have led him to set up his grocery business.  He has a small shop where he sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, fruit juice and fizzy drinks.  He devotes 12 hours a day to his business. He is seeking the loan to invest in working capital and to stock his business buying and selling groceries so that, in the not too distant future, he will be able to boost his income.  Carlos is grateful to Kiva lenders for enabling economically disadvantaged people to have a decent job and for the help they provide for poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, fruit juice and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for his house.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 38 years old. She is married with seven children. 

She would like to get a loan to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Antoinnette

texts.en:
Antoinnette is 63 years old. She is married with three children. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more juices, soaps, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more more juices, soaps, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish to expand her sales.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her grocery business and earn a higher income. In addition to the fruits and vegetable business, she sells coconuts and dumplings.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.40,000 to buy more coconuts, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza City, where he lives with his wife and one child in a small simple house. Hasan works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low salary, which is the family's only source of income. Hasan's wife is a student at a local university where she studies Elementary Education. She is a very clever student. She would like to complete her studies and find a job as a teacher to help her husband. 

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his wife's studies. By taking this loan, Hasan's wife will be able to do her homework and to write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his wife's studies

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Asmaa is a 21-year-old married woman from Gaza City, where she lives with her husband in a small simple house. Her husband works as a bus driver in the city, and this is the family's only source of income. Asmaa is a student at a local university where she studies Information Systems. She is a very clever student who has good grades. 

Asmaa took a USD loan from FATEN to help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Asmaa will be able to do her homework and to write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Catalina Beatriz

texts.es: Catalina de 24 años de edad vive con su hija de 7 años de edad junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia. Catalina desde hace 3 años trabaja como costurera independiente y en su vivienda ha instalado su pequeño taller. Ella se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un préstamo para dar un mantenimiento a su máquina de coser que es su principal herramienta de trabajo, además desea comprar variedad de tela e hilos para elaborar faldas, blusas para damas que pondrá a la venta; así incrementar más sus ingresos para dar mejor educación a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Catalina is 24 years old. She lives with her life companion and her 7 year old child in their own house. For the past three years Catalina has been working as an independent seamstress in a small workshop in her home.

Catalina has come to FUSAI to request a loan to do maintenance on her sewing machine, which is her main tool for work. She also wants to purchase a variety of cloth and thread to make skirts, blouses for woman which she will put on sale. This will increase her revenues and she can give her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth and thread and to do maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is a 41-years-old married man living in village Dighomi near the capital of Georgia. He has a wife, 2 sons and a daughter. The only income for this large family is 200 GEL monthly, which his wife generates from selling products of Oriflame. Aleksandre doesn't have a job and the family needs much more money. 

He decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Aleksandre applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2000 will help Aleksandre to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them.  Aleksandre is a very hard working person with a great will to ensure his children with a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 32 years old, married with one child, and lives in the suburb of capital city-Tbilisi. Zviad’s wife is a clothing designer and sews apparel for special orders. She works from her house and has loyal clients. 

In order to generate a good income for his family's well-being, Zviad is requesting a Kiva loan. With the received amount he will purchase a coffee grinder and coffee. Zviad will sell coffee and offer grinding services to his clients. He will also buy Georgian spices for selling from his small store. Zviad plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which he will use to improve the family’s living conditions and finance the education of his child. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a coffee grinder, coffee and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ladies hand bags for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice to improve her business.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en: Blandine is a young Cameroonian, aged 30, who is married and has a 1 1/2-year-old child. She has been in business for over a year, which makes her experienced and stable. Blandine's business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by fifty percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goat and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Umeri

texts.en: Umeri, 44,is a married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Umeri makes enough to provide for her family. To stock her store fully, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation; she will use this loan to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. Umeri wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 6th loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is a 49-year-old woman; she has been selling cloths for the past two years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena  de  66  años de edad, no  tiene hijos que dependen de ella, es madre soltera , vive en casa de un hermano, no tiene casa propia, vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 06 años  a la actividad de venta de tamales pisques, tamal de gallina, pastelitos.
Doña María Elena su venta es con los amigos, vecinos y personas que viven aledaños a su comunidad, se transporta en un carretón a vender dichos, productos ya que antes lo hacía a pie y ya está cansada por eso decidió comprarse este medio de transporte que le ha beneficiado mucho ya que ahora visita mas lugares y por ende vende más. 
Doña María Elena está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, hojas, carne de pollo, res, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar su negocio ya que en esta época navideña se vende bastante este producto es un buen cliente que solicita su quinto préstamo.
Doña María Elena su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
María Elena is 66 years old. She is a single mother but she has no children who still depend on her. As she has no house of her own she lives with a brother in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in the south of Honduras.

For the past six years María Elena has been selling tamales and pastries. She sells to friends, neighbors and other who live around her community. She uses a small cart to sell her product. She used to sell on foot but this was tiring so she decided to buy this type of transportation. It has been a great benefit as she can visit more places and in the end sell more.

María Elena is requesting a loan to buy raw material like corn, wood, leaves, chicken, beef, etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her business as in this Christmas season her product sells well. She is a good client, this is her 5th loan. Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, leaves, chicken and beef, etc for her business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad, age 23, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Noor  Jahan

texts.en: Noor Jahan is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She makes and sells samosas for a living. Samosas are fried or baked pastries with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, lentils or chicken. She is an expert in making delicious samosas and earns enough through this business to contribute in the family income. In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices, so she applied a loan of 40,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 23-year-old vigorous woman. She has been stitching clothes with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Both stitch clothes for the people of their community to earn a good amount of income. 

In order to complete customers' orders on time, Samina needs to purchase spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. Samina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her three children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase thread, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 33-year-old vigorous woman who has been stitching clothes for the past 10 years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

Abida has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue to generate a healthier source of income. Abida is in her 6th loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more thread, laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Laurentine

texts.en: Laurentine is a Cameroonian, age 29, and is single with two children. The older child is ten while the younger is six; both are in primary school. She has been in the beauty salon business for over a year now which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed as it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her turnover by 12 percent and her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand hair dryer.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 7 years. She offers various goods such as bangles, laces and ribbons and reels of threads, etc. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a laborer and doesn’t earn much to support his family alone. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a variety of bangles, ribbons and spools of threads in various colors. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bangles, ribbons and spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine, 44 years old, lives in her old house, located in a capital city suburb. She is married and has two grown sons living with her. For nearly 10 years, Marine has worked in the hospital as a nurse, earning a small monthly salary (approximately $135). 

In order to meet her increasing household expenses, Marine plans to renovate one of her rooms and rent it out. She will use this Kiva loan to buy construction materials and to pay for workers. After the renovation, Marine will get rent from lodgers and have additional monthly funds. This will be a great relief for the family and Marine will be able to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to renovate a room for renting out

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is 35 years old and the mother of four children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is 37 years old. She has been selling milk in her community for many years. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow to increase the production capacity of milk. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Abdel Majeed

texts.en:
Abdel Majeed is a 19-years-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. Abdel's father works in transfering goods using his rickshaw where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Abdel  is a student in a local university where he studies the Arabic language. He is a very clever student and he would like to complete his education and find a job as a teacher. Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his education. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his education.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 50 years old. She is married with four children, they all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy cows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. She was very pleased with the previous loan, "which helped in putting her business on a high level," as she narrates.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia, age 28, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 34 years old. She sells various items in a boutique. With this loan, she wants to buy more maize flour, plastic cups, sandals and many retail items to resell. The profits from the business will be saved to ensure a better future for Dancille.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, plastic cups and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is appreciative for her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards. She still operates a food stall business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and cashew nuts for her business. Mwanasha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and cashew nuts for her business

loans.name: Rashda

texts.en: Rashda, age 43, is a married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill her family demands including food, healthcare and education. She started her business sewing gloves 7 years ago. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers but due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of thread. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Zulaikha

texts.en: Zulaikha is 48 years old and a married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the feast of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Imboneza Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Imboneza et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 57 ans et est marié à M. Thérèse,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants dont 6 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  bananes depuis 30  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jerome is part of the Imboneza group and lives in Gitega. He is 57 years old and is married to Thérèse, a crop farmer. Together they have seven children, six of whom attend school.

He has been trading bananas for the past 30 years. 

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the loan from Kiva, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Haminsi

texts.en: Haminsi is 48 years old. He is married with three children. He sells various merchandise in his business. With the loan, Haminsi would like to buy more potatoes, rice, and goats to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land, on which he expects to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, rice and goats to resell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 41-year-old married woman who has sold milk for the past two years. She has five calves and two milk cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. Rukhsana has seven children; she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and a good education, food and clothing.  Rukhsana has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her sixth year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for calves. Rukhsana hopes to be able to increase the production of milk, which will ultimately help her generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for calves.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 26-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Nasreen has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation. Nasreen intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to sew more dresses on time and generate a healthier source of income. Nasreen is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 29-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Robina makes enough money to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, Robina has requested a loan for PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Robina wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
This is Mauwa. Her previous loan was a big help to her business and she was able to purchase more stationery for her school. Beside being a school teacher, she sells cashew nuts.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase chalk, books, pens and sacks of cashew nuts. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chalk, books, pens and sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman aged 46 with 6 children all attending different schools in different areas. She lives with her family in the Rakai town council area and she also caters for 3 children whose parents are dead.

She deals in a hardware business which is also located in the Rakai town council area. She is also a produce trader which she considers as her side business. She started her hardware business in 1995.  She works all the seven days of the week and 13 hours per day. She began her business to develop and earn a living, and she acquired this loan to pay tuition for her children. Her clients are traders from the nearby villages.

Her future hope is to enlarge her business such that she can start exporting vehicles from aboard. The challenge she faces is that many traders order on credit which hinders the growth of her business. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, two of whom go to school and one is underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She sells cooking oil and she has been in this business for the past one year. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase jerrycans of cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase jerrycans of cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past year she has practiced farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase seeds and pesticides for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Athanasius

texts.en:
Athanasius is a 45-year-old father of six children aged 16, 14, 10, 9, 5 and 4-years-old, of which only three attend school. He has eight other dependents who are ophans.  He is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically growing bananas and coffee. He works for five days in a week and six hours in a day.  Athanasius started his farming business way back in 1993 and was motivated by the high profits in the business.

He also supplements his income with teaching in the primary school which has enabled him to improve his living standards. He usually sells his agricultural output to the neighboring villages, especially to local customers.

He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy more fertilizers to boost his agricultural output.  And he hopes in time to be a leading supplier of agricultural products in his home area.  However, he faces various challenges while doing his business like long seasons of drought, lack of enough capital plus fluctuating prices of agricultural products.  He is described as an honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, 52, runs an animal sales business. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Zubaida needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another calf. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf

loans.name: Martha Elisabet

texts.es:
Martha de 32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Esta madre se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar sus estudios. En la actualidad su mayor motivación son sus hijos, el cual desea cumplir sus sueños como es poder formar a sus hijos en profesionales y personas de bien para la sociedad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una panadería, ubicada en su casa de habitación.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en materia prima para la elaboración del pan como harina, huevos, mantequilla, azúcar, leche.  Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old and is married with three young children. She is from Jinotepe, located in the northern part of the country. This mother is known as hard-working and responsible, and has a great desire to get ahead personally. Unfortunately she did not go to school because she lacked the economic resources to do so. Her children are now her greatest motivation. She wishes to fulfill her dreams to make her children into professionals and people who will contribute to the good of society. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she owns a bakery located in her home. She invests twelve hours each day into her business to offer her products to new and recurring customers. This loan will be used to invest in ingredients to make bread including flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, and milk. This will allow her to have greater earnings in the not so distant future. Martha is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to those of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock her business with the ingredients to make bread including flour, eggs, shortening, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 38-year-old married woman. She recently started a general store business to meet her household expenditures. She offers various goods for daily use. 

Sajida has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, Sajida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demands. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes dont le nom « Diambars de Doumassou » expression qui signifie vaillant. Ces dernières partagent  des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles vivent dans le même quartier, et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta, (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04  enfants dont 01 fille et 03 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de jus à base de bissap, de pain de singe et de gingembre qu’elle achète au près de producteurs concernant les feuilles de bissap et le pain de singe par contre elle se procure le gingembre au marché central. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus de cinq ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 05 bassines de feuilles de bissap à 2 500 F CFA, 03 sacs de pain de singe à 6 000 F CFA l’un, du sucre au moins deux sacs de 50 Kg, des colorants alimentaires et divers ingrédients.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille sur le plan de la nourriture, de la santé et de la scolarité des enfants  et le reste lui servira d’épargne.
texts.en:
This group consists of women, and its name " Diambars of Doumassou " is an expression meaning valiant. Group members share values ​​of solidarity and mutual aid. They live in the same neighborhood and their main activity is small retail business.

Ms. Binta (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children, one girl and three boys. She sells juice made from hibiscus, monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) and ginger. She buys the hibiscus leaves and monkey bread from local producers but resupplies with ginger in the central market. She has acquired solid experience in this business, having practiced it for more than five years.

With this loan she will buy five basins of hibiscus leaves at 2,500 CFA francs each, three bags of monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) at 6,000 CFA francs each, at least two 50-kg bags of sugar, food coloring and various ingredients.

The profits from her activites will enable her to actively participate in taking care of family needs in terms of food, healthcare and the children's education. The rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: buy five basins of hibiscus leaves at 2,500 CFA francs each, three bags of monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) at 6,000 CFA francs each, at least two 50-kg bags of sugar, food coloring and various ingredients.

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama is still single with no children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man aged 45 with 7 children, of which 6 are attending different schools. He also lives with 4 of his relatives whom he takes care of. He lives with his family in a rural setting and he is a produce trader where he sells coffee, beans, maize and groundnuts and is also a salary earner. He started his business in 2008.

He works 6 days in a week and 12 hours per day and started his business to improve on his family's income and livelihood because he believes if he has money then he will adequately provide for his family and dependents. He acquired this loan to purchase more coffee and maize for the business and his clients are schools that stock for student meals and coffee dealers from the nearby villages.

His hope for the future is to enlarge his business so as to increase on his income. His challenges are drought (i.e too much sunshine) and heavy rains at times. He describes himself as an honest, hardworking man who encourages lenders to continue helping business people so as to develop communities.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, fufu, fish, pepper, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 25 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 2. Many years ago, she established  her goat-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy baby goats. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a widowed mother of five children who go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Miriam prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She also sells cashew nuts.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil for her business. Miriam joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Durga Maa Group

texts.en:
Ganga is the leader of a group that hails from Kotapeta village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 44 years of age. The member standing at the middle with raised hand is Ganga. 

She is managing a business of leaf plate-making and selling in her locality. Her husband is doing a seasonal business. Ganga has a family of five members consisting of her husband and three children about 18, 12 and 8 years old.
 
Ganga, along with four other members of her village, formed a group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expansion of their existing businesses. It is the first time the group will take a loan from MSF.

Out of their small incomes they are maintaining their families in a low profile. At present, her monthly income is Rs.5,000 but still it is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. After learning the business procedure and knowledge, she wants to increase the volume of her business. Now she wants a loan to purchase leaf plates for stitching and wholesaling also.

In future, she wants to establish a grocery shop in her village.
  
The other members are Waralaxmi, Parvati, Dhanalaxmi and Goureswari and they want loans for leaf plate-making, tailoring, grocery shop and leaf plate wholesaling, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase leaf plates for stitching and wholesaling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33 years old. She has been selling different items in her boutique, but with this loan she wants to buy more batteries, biscuits and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more batteries, biscuits and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. Ali's father works as a fisherman earning an unstable income. This is the family's only source of income. Ali is a student in a local university where he studies elementary education. He is a very clever student. He would like to complete his studies and find a job as a teacher to help his spouse. 

Ali took a 600 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a widowed woman and a mother of seven children.

Fatuma has operated a firewood selling business for the past 20 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She also sells palm leaves 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and palm leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, rice, toothpaste, soap, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.en: Bertrand is a 38-year-old Cameroonian who is married with seven children. His oldest child is seventeen and is in secondary school, while his youngest is six months old. He has been in the fruit selling business for over fifteen years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.This loan will increase his turnover by twenty percent and his standard of living will improve as a result.

loans.use: to buy fruit in large quantities to resell.

loans.name: Gerifati

texts.en:
Gerafati is gratefull to the Kiva lenders for the funding they gave him previously. His output increased with the fertilized land and so did his income.
He is a farmer who grows bananas on a large scale. He works four days in a week and eight hours in a day. He started farming in 1998. He supplements his agriculture business with a produce business that enables him to earn extra.

Gerafati usually sells his output in trading centres nearby and to other traders from Kampala city. He hopes to use this loan to boost his agricultural business and also has a dream of becoming the region's leading producer of matooke, a starchy banana often used in cooking.

He has some challenges in his work like drought seasons, which affect the output, as well as the unstable prices of agricultural products. He is described as a hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his banana plants.

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Godfred specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates and sandpaper for production.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"As a child, I used to make boats with worn-out metal utensils, which I'd float in water. Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education and so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve!

"I really do not know where I would be now if it wasn't for the support I have been receiving from you through your contributors to this microcredit. I thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Godfred's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site: www.novica.com/kiva/7252

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates and sandpaper for production.

loans.name: Keyling Fabiola

texts.es: Keyling Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Ella a pesar de su nivel económico ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, ha cumplido las metas propuestas  y se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hoy en día. Su familia la apoya de igual manera, su Mama quiere y desea que su hija sea una excelente profesional y se siente orgullosa de su hija y de lo que ha logrado. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos y así lograr obtener su título profesional. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Keyling Fabiola is 21 years old and originally from the city of León. She is single and studying at one of the city's universities. Despite her financial situation, Keyling has gotten ahead with a lot of effort and dedication. She has achieved her goals and is proud of what she has done up to now. Keyling's family supports her; her mother wants her daughter to be a great professional and she is proud of her and what she has achieved. Keyling is applying for this loan in order to pay for her modules so as to then receive her degree certificate. Keyling's plan for the future is to find a job where she can apply the knowledge she has gained.

loans.use: to pay for her modules so as to then receive her degree certificate.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
Sandhyarani is a 44-year-old lady who lives in a small town named Kolnara in the Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is the leader of a four-member group. Her family comprises her husband and a son of about 24 years of age. The woman standing second from left with raised hand is Sandhyarani. 

At present she is doing a milk business in her locality. She has a cow. Her husband is also supporting her in taking care of the cow and marketing the milk. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income with her own efforts. Her family income is about Rs.6,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.
 
It is the first time the group will avail a loan from MSF. From the loan she will purchase a Jersey cow. 
 
Of the other three members of the group, two, named Jayanti and Panala, want a loan for a milk business, and Rukuna wants a loan for a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Annah is married and has six children who attend school.  She is a farmer in a village cell and she rears and sells cows, which she has been doing since 1998.  In addition to her trade in cows, she also grows and sells tea for additional income. Her major reason for starting the business was to earn money to support her family. 

Annah is requesting a loan from UGAFODE for 4,000,000 UGX, which she will use to buy grazing land for her cattle, allowing them feed well and therefore increase output so Annah earns more profits. On the same land, she will put a house for her family. Her major challenge is competition but she is hopeful that it will no longer be a challenge if she receives the loan. Annah is also challenged by lack of enough capital but she hopes that this will not be a challenge any more. 

Annah describes herself as an honest lady and believes that her honesty is what has helped her survive in business. She is hopeful that she will get her dream in life to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase grazing land

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple, house in the city. Mousa's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. That is the only source of income for the family. Mousa is a student at a local university, where he studies agricultural and environmental science. He is very clever student, and he would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family. Mousa took out a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy a new laptop to use in his studies. Because of this loan, Mousa will be able to do his assignments and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 43 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She is married and has two pretty daughters. Anna works at a preschool educational institution as a mentor. She is very active and kind person, and she loves the children very much. She organizes a variety of interesting and cheerful morning performances, and she teaches the children nice poems, painting, singing and various development games. She also has a nice hobby--she does needlework. Thanks to her original designs and great imagination, she makes masterpieces with needle and thread, and she manages to sells her work to various shops and to fill private orders. Anna is applying for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which will help her to learn more about needlework. She plans to advertise her work on the Internet and get more orders.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help her to learn more about needlework and advertise her work.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana and her family live in Kapan city in Syunik region. Svetlana graduated from Yerevan State University, and now she works at the local school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. Svetlana is married, and she has a son, who is now doing his military service in the army, and a daughter who works at a bank as a loan specialist. Her husband is also employed and, in addition to their jobs, the whole family is engaged in farming activities, where they help each other. At the nearby village of Tandzaver, they have a nice, cute, farm, where they are raising ten piglets and maintain twenty beehives. They sell meat and very tasty honey from their farm. Svetlana would very much like to increase the number of beehives. Svetlana is applying for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder for their piglets and also several beehives.

loans.use: to buy several new beehives and fodder for their piglets

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is 55 years old and lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Taguhi has graduated from Pedagogical College and from her graduation till now, already 31 years, she has worked at the local school. Taguhi is married and has a son and a daughter; both of them are married and they live separately with their families. Taguhi’s husband is also employed, but he also together with his wife is engaged in farming and they do it with great pleasure. In their farm they have four cows, three bulls, three piglets, five sheep and fifty chickens. All of their farm products (meat, milk and eggs) they sell to their loyal customers from their house.
Taguhi asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to become more specialized in swine breeding and to buy several piglets.

loans.use: to become more specialized in swine breeding and to buy several piglets

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is already taking his second loan from Kiva. He lives in the village of Tandzaver in the Sunikskiy region with his wife and his son. His daughter is married and she lives with her family. Kamo’s son has already graduated from college and he now greatly helps his father in farming. Kamo together with farming simultaneously works as forester and at the television station as a man of duty. Kamo owns a plot of land where he grows mainly fruits and vegetables. He also breeds large horned cattle and chickens. Kamo’s wife now is unemployed, but she used to work as a librarian at their village and she also helped her husband to sell vegetables and fruit of their farm, but now she has problems connected with her heart and the doctor directed urgent heart surgery.

Kamo asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to pay for his wife’s heart operation.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s heart heart operation fees

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved décor items. Nana is the chief carver for the king of the Ashanti. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood and polish for production.

Nana has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I draw inspiration from traditional kente cloth designs, from my family background, and from our rich Ashanti tradition. Some of my work for the king includes objects with "gye nyame" (a symbol for the supremacy of God), stools, staffs and other royal and ceremonial objects. My dream has always been to invest in my children's education. I am happy to say that this is now possible.

"My family and I will always be grateful to all the contributors to my microcredit."

Use the link below to view Nana's wood carvings on the NOVICA site: www.novica.com/kiva/1482

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and polish for production.

loans.name: Eloctwkwa Francis.

texts.en: Eloctwkwa Francis is 35 years old and lives in New Kru Town, an established and well-known town in Liberia. He is married and he is a high school graduate. He has a two-year-old child who stays at home. For the last year, he has been selling stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks from a shop in his community. He makes lots of profits, since he is the only one who is involved in this business in his community. A problem he is facing is his low income. He is applying  for a loan to buy more stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks for his business. He plan is to build a decent house and educate his children. He wants to thank all the lenders of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks for his business.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is a 60-year-old lady who lives in the Chiatura district with her husband and a grown daughter. The only breadwinner in the household is Makvala’s husband, who works as an engine-driver at the local mining company. 

In order to generate income and meet her household expenses, Makvala plans to start a small bakery where Khachapuri (traditional Georgian cheese pie) will be baked. Makvala is an experienced baker and used to work in that business for years. Makvala will bake pies herself and work hard all day long to generate income.

She will start the business in a hired commercial space. The location is great and Makvala hopes that this initiative will be lucrative. With the loan, she will buy an oven and all of the equipment necessary for baking. Her husband and daughter will help her to run the business. Makvala awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a Khachapuri (Georgian cheese pie) bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more computers and provide better services to his customers.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 38-years-old.  She is married and has two children aged 21 and 17.  Many years ago, she established  her cow raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a milk giving cow.  In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards.

She still operates a food stall business. She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and beans for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Diana Maritza

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en Manta.
Doña Diana es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer por la localidad  casi todas las mañanas visitando a sus clientes habituales ya sea para cobrar los productos que deja a crédito o ofreciendo nuevos productos. Tiene 7  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual lucha para darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The credit group 20 de Abril (April 20th) meets every 15 days in the Montecristi neighborhood, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known nationally and internationally. It is also known for making the famous broad-brimmed straw hats. 

This is where Diana lives.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children from this relationship.  They are 15 and 13 years old and are in high school. Her husband works for a company in Manta.  Diana is a housewife but sells shoes from a catalog as well as Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) so that she can have some money of her own and help her husband with the expenses for her children's education. Almost every morning she travels through her neighborhood visiting her regular customers either to collect payment for the products she has sold on credit or to offer new products. She has been doing this for seven years, fighting to provide her children with the best education possible. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.  She has been with the credit group for four years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful to her.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a second-time borrower applying for 2,000,000 UGX. He is a single father of one child that he stays with in a one-room house he rents in the outskirts of the city. For survival, Stanley drives a special hire taxi that belongs to his boss. It is this money he gets from the special hire taxi that has helped him acquire a piece of land and service his previous loan with ease and with no delays. 

Stanley has one major challenge of staying in a rented house. To fight this problem, he has embarked on constructing a simple residential house that is now at the foundation stage as seen in the photo. Now that he wants to put the house at a further stage, he has again opted for another loan to see it at another stage that is at least at the beam level. He is so fed up with pressure from his landlord and he hopes to be able to complete the house soon and occupy it.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a business woman in Kizinda where her drug shop business is located.  She is a mother of four children and she is 42-years-old. She started the business in the year 1994 with an objective of making income so that she could pay school fees for all her children.  She also has a butchery in addition to the drug shop business and she says this helps her a lot since it gives her additional income which she uses to cater to the needs of the family. Her clients are people around Ishaka who go to her to buy drugs for their sick relatives.  Her main challenge is competition since there are several drug shops in the same area where she operates from but she believes that if she is given a loan of 3,000,000 UGX she will restock the drug shop and will out compete her competitors. Her future hopes include establishing other drug shop outlets so that she makes more sales and earns more profits.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple, house in the city. Mohammad's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student at a local university, where he studies accounting. He is very clever student, and he would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family. Mohammad took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This loan will help Mohammad do his assignments and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: La Foi De Aculesamedi Group

texts.fr:
Delima est le coordinateur de son groupe La Foi de Aculesamedi. Il n'est pas mariee. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité.

Il dirige son commerce de vente de du charbon pendants les 9 derniers années. Avant de ce commercé ce commerce Il était enseignant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de La Foi de Aculesamedi ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défit principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir une plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera à voyagé dans des autre pays tel que panama.
texts.en:
Delima is the coordinator of the La Foi de Aculesamedi Group. He is not married. He lives in the north of Haitia, where electricity is rare and access to drinking water very limited. He has been running a business selling charcoal for the last nine years. Before going into this business, he used to be a teacher. He hopes that this loan will allow him to grow his business. 

Other members of the La Foi de Aculesamedi group need loans for their business such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, food items, charcoal etc. Delima says that his biggest challenge is to increase his sales volume. His main goal is to expand his business, which will allow him to travel to other countries, such as Panama.

loans.use: to buy firewood.
